basics.name: Mahmoud Mokhiamar
basics.label: AI Researcher and Engineer
basics.summary: Senior Computer Science student at E-JUST with research experience in NeuroInformatics, Data Engineering, and Natural Language Processing. Passionate about building scalable AI systems, Natural Language Processing, interpretable models, and NeuroInformatics.

work.name: University of Tsukuba, Japan
work.position: Research Assistant – Knowledge and Data Engineering Lab
work.summary: Developed pipelines for transforming unstructured text into structured knowledge graphs using LLMs, improving retrieval efficiency by 40%.
highlights: Built scalable ETL pipelines for PDF-to-graph transformation.
Optimized LLM parsing strategies to standardize diverse recipe formats.

work.name: University of Tsukuba, Japan
work.summary: Analyzed EEG data to improve sleep stage classification using deep learning and generative data augmentation techniques.
highlights: Achieved 75% F1 score with Transformer-based models on EEG signals.
Used DeltaEncoder and cGAN for balancing highly imbalanced sleep data.

work.name: Dell Technologies, Egypt
work.summary: Developed CNN models for dementia MRI classification and applied Grad-CAM for model interpretability.
highlights: Achieved 92% F1 Score on multiclass dementia classification task.
Highlighted key brain regions using Explainable AI (Grad-CAM).

work.name: Orange Business, Egypt
work.summary: Built cloud-native deployments using Docker, Nginx, and Kubernetes with load balancing and HA configurations.
highlights: Awarded Best Internship Project.
Deployed full-stack application to Kubernetes with public Ingress.

education.institution: Egypt-Japan University of Science and Technology (E-JUST)
education.area: Computer Science (Artificial Intelligence and Data Science)

awards.title: Best Internship Project
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding cloud deployment project integrating Docker, Kubernetes, and public cloud architectures.

awards.title: Best Presenter
awards.summary: Recognized for excellent technical presentation and communication skills during Orange Business internship.

projects.name: Fashion Products Chatbot
projects.summary: Semantic search chatbot for fashion product recommendation using FAISS, LangChain, and Hugging Face Transformers.
highlights: Deployed a FastAPI service for product retrieval.
Embedded and indexed fashion product descriptions.

projects.name: Real-Time ASL GPT
projects.summary: Built a real-time American Sign Language recognition system integrated with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
highlights: Trained SqueezeFormer model on 200GB ASL video data.
Real-time low-latency gesture recognition pipeline.

projects.name: EEG Sleep Classification
projects.summary: Transformer-based deep learning model for EEG sleep stage classification, using cGAN and DeltaEncoder for data augmentation.
highlights: Addressed class imbalance using generative models.
Achieved 75% F1 score across multiple sleep stages.

projects.name: Alzheimer-XAI
projects.summary: Explainable AI project classifying dementia stages using CNNs with Grad-CAM visualization for clinical interpretability.
highlights: Achieved 92% F1 Score in dementia classification.
Generated Grad-CAM maps highlighting critical brain regions.

projects.name: Sparse Supervision for Remote Sensing Segmentation
projects.summary: DeepLabV3+ based semantic segmentation for satellite images with only 1% labeled data using Partial Cross-Entropy Loss.
highlights: Achieved 0.43 mIoU under extreme label sparsity.
Evaluated different label densities (1%, 5%, 10%).

projects.name: Knowledge Graphs using LLM
projects.summary: Automated extraction and transformation of unstructured text (recipes) into knowledge graphs using LLMs like GPT-4 and Mistral.
highlights: Built end-to-end ETL pipelines reducing processing time by 40%.
Standardized and structured 1000+ documents into graph format.
